paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant V122I, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: In consecutive patients with HFpEF over the age of 60 years with a left ventricular wall thickness of 12 mm or greater screened with bone scintigraphy, the prevalence of wild-type ATTR-CM was 13%.
Patients with ATTR-CM, who develop symptomatic HF, have progressive decline in functional status and quality of life.

functional_data.summary: The V122I variant is associated with misfolding and aggregation of TTR protein.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The V122I variant is the most common variant associated with hereditary ATTR-CM.
key_quotes: ATTR-CM may occur due to a variant in the TTR gene (hereditary ATTR-CM, most commonly the V122I variant, which is present in 3–4% of African Americans).

tables_processed.table_caption: Demographic and clinical characteristics of the five cohorts included in the study.

extraction_metadata.notes: Extracted data was consistent and well-documented in the paper.
